poem.content:
The spider spun a romance, fine and thin,
across the dusty van window, grimed with coast.
He wasn't aware the journey starts within,
a beauty born where dreams are almost lost.

An indoor life, a test of will and grace,
to truly see the opera in the rain.
And I approve this quiet, cluttered space,
though sunlight struggles through the window pane.

A gap appears, a sudden, shining gleam,
the chimney breathes a sigh of weary days.
We drove along the memories, a stream,
that catches fire in the fading haze.

The van, a haven on the lonely edge,
where life unfolds, a story left untold.
A weathered map upon the window ledge,
a tale of silver where there once was gold.

And though our path is neither clear nor grand,
this fragile, fleeting moment understands.
